statement.title: Content
statement.content: You are given a sequence of $n$ integers $a\_1, a\_2,\cdots , a\_n$ in non-decreasing order. In addition to that, you are given several queries consisting of indices $i$ and $j$ ($1\leq i\leq j\leq n$). For each query, determine the most frequent value among the integers $a\_i ,\cdots , a\_j$.

statement.title: Standard Input
statement.content:
The input consists of several test cases. Each test case starts with a line containing two integers $n$ and $q$ ($1\leq n, q\leq 100000$). The next line contains $n$ integers $a\_1 , \cdots , a\_n$ ($-100000\leq a\_i\leq 100000$, for each $i\in [1, \cdots, n]$) separated by spaces. You can assume that for each $i \in [1, \cdots, n-1]: a\_i \leq a\_{i+1}$. The following $q$ lines contain one query each, consisting of two integers $i$ and $j$ ($1\leq i\leq j\leq n$), which indicate the boundary indices for the 
query.

The last test case is followed by a line containing a single $0$.

statement.title: Standard Output
statement.content: For each query, print one line with one integer: The number of occurrences of the most frequent value within the given range.

statement.title: Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
10 3 -1 -1 1 1 1 1 3 10 10 10 2 3 1 10 5 10 01 4 3
